perturbation.original_text: 4.6.1. Scope of Warranty. Accuray will provide a warranty to each Customer that the Products will be free from material defects and perform substantially in accordance with the written Specifications provided by Accuray as reflected in the regulatory clearance at the time of sale for a period of one (1) year following Installation of the Products at Customer's facility, but not to exceed eighteen (18) months following shipment of such Products to Distributor ("Warranty Period"). "Installation" of the System shall occur upon completion by Accuray or the entity installing the System, as applicable, of Accuray's acceptance test procedure demonstrating that the System substantially conforms to the written Specifications. If Accuray does not perform the Installation, Distributor will notify Accuray in writing within ten (10) days following Installation (including any testing procedures undertaken by Customer or its installation service provider). In no event shall Distributor, Customer or their respective agents use the System (or any portion thereof) for any purpose before Installation thereof without the express written approval of Accuray. Distributor 8 shall indemnify and hold Accuray harmless from any such use. Accuray makes no warranty that the operation of any software will be uninterrupted or error-free. Except as set forth in the preceding sentences, Accuray makes no warranties or representations to Customers or to any other party regarding any Products or Services provided by Accuray. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ACCURAY DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ANY WARRANTIES ARISING OUT OF COURSE OF DEALING OR USAGE OF TRADE.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.6.1. Scope of Warranty. Accuray may, at its discretion, provide a warranty to each Customer that the Products will be free from material defects. The duration and terms of such warranty, if provided, will be determined solely by Accuray. "Installation" of the System shall occur upon completion by Accuray or the entity installing the System, as applicable, of Accuray's acceptance test procedure demonstrating that the System substantially conforms to the written Specifications. If Accuray does not perform the Installation, Distributor will notify Accuray in writing following Installation. Use of the System before Installation is permitted without approval of Accuray. Accuray makes no warranty that the operation of any software will be uninterrupted or error-free. Except as set forth in the preceding sentences, Accuray makes no warranties or representations to Customers or to any other party regarding any Products or Services provided by Accuray. TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ACCURAY DISCLAIMS ALL OTHER WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS, WHETHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, AND ANY WARRANTIES ARISING OUT OF COURSE OF DEALING OR USAGE OF TRADE.
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the mandatory one-year warranty and replaces it with discretionary warranty terms determined by Accuray. It also eliminates the need for explicit approval of using the system before installation and shortens the notification period.
perturbation.law_explanation: The Magnuson-Moss Warranty Act sets minimum standards for written consumer product warranties. By making the warranty discretionary and undefined, the contract potentially violates the Act's requirements for clear and definite warranty terms, especially if the product is sold to consumers in the U.S.

perturbation.original_text: 3.7. Customer Complaints. Distributor shall report promptly and in writing to Accuray any complaints or expressions of dissatisfaction by the Customers to Distributor relating to the Products or Services. Any such reports shall be provided to Accuray via electronic mail to the following address: complaints@accuray.com.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.7. Customer Complaints. Distributor may, at its discretion, report complaints or expressions of dissatisfaction by the Customers to Distributor relating to the Products or Services. Reporting of such complaints is not required.
perturbation.explanation: This change makes the reporting of customer complaints discretionary rather than mandatory. This could lead to unreported safety issues or product defects.
perturbation.law_explanation: This change may contradict 21 CFR § 820.198, which requires medical device manufacturers to have procedures for receiving, reviewing, and evaluating complaints. By making complaint reporting discretionary, the distributor could fail to pass on critical information to Accuray, hindering their ability to comply with FDA regulations regarding complaint handling and potential adverse event reporting.

perturbation.original_text: 4.6.3. Software and Bug Fixes. Notwithstanding Section 4.6.2, for a period of 10 years following Installation of a System, Accuray will provide to Customer, without charge, Bug Fixes with respect to any software included in the System. This is Accuray's sole and exclusive obligation and Customer's and Distributor's sole and exclusive remedy in relation to defective software. By way of clarification, Accuray's sole obligation shall be to make such Bug Fixes available to Customer, and Accuray shall have no obligation (unless otherwise agreed by the Customer and Accuray) for installation or implementation of such Bug Fixes at the Customer's site. "Bug Fix" means an error correction or minor change in the existing software and/or hardware configuration that is required in order to enable the existing software and/or hardware configuration to perform to the existing functional specification(s).
perturbation.changed_text: 4.6.3. Software and Bug Fixes. Accuray may provide Bug Fixes with respect to any software included in the System. Accuray's sole obligation shall be to make such Bug Fixes available to Customer, and Accuray shall have no obligation for installation or implementation of such Bug Fixes at the Customer's site. "Bug Fix" means an error correction or minor change in the existing software and/or hardware configuration that is required in order to enable the existing software and/or hardware configuration to perform to the existing functional specification(s).
perturbation.explanation: This change removes the guaranteed 10-year period for providing bug fixes, making it discretionary. This could lead to cybersecurity vulnerabilities and reduced product safety.
perturbation.contradicted_law: 21 CFR Part 820 - Quality System Regulation, Cybersecurity Regulations
perturbation.law_explanation: This change potentially contradicts 21 CFR § 820.100 which requires manufacturers to establish and maintain procedures for corrective and preventative action. By removing the guaranteed bug fix period, Accuray might fail to adequately address software defects that could impact device safety and effectiveness. Additionally, with increasing concerns about cybersecurity in medical devices, failure to provide timely bug fixes can violate cybersecurity guidelines and best practices outlined in frameworks like the NIST Cybersecurity Framework.
